intro: Phalangium laxiflorum, commonly known as the slender-flowered phalangium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
